class kivymd.theme.ThemeManager(**kwargs)¶

The ThemeManager() manage the overall appearance by implementing the Material Design style guidelines for colors and fonts.

Note

This is a work in progress and not a complete implementation of all the parts of the official Material Design.

To create an instance of the Theme Manager in you app:

from kivymd.theme import ThemeManager

# Create the manager
theme_manager = ThemeManager()

Theme style

The Material theme comes in two styles, Light and Dark. This setting defines the background color of the app:

# Set the overall theme style by choosing between ``Light`` or ``Dark``
theme_manager.theme_style = 'Dark'

This will determine the background colors and text colors:

main_background_color - This is the main background color for the app.

Note

  • Light: main_background_color = Grey 200
  • Dark: main_background_color = #303030

dialog_background_color - This is the background color used by MaterialDialog() and MaterialCard.

Note

  • Light: dialog_background_color = Grey 50
  • Dark: dialog_background_color = Grey 800

Theme colors

The rest of the user interface uses colors from a pre-defined set of colors organized in palettes. The ThemeManager() handles two palettes, one for the primary colors and one for the accent colors:

# Set the primary color palette
theme_manager.primary_palette = 'Blue'

These color palettes comprises primary and accent colors that can be used for illustration or to develop your brand colors. They’ve been designed to work harmoniously with each other.

Each palette is divided into 10 primary colors (‘50’, ‘100’ ... ‘900’) and 4 accent colors (‘A100’, ‘A200’, ‘A400’ and ‘A700). These colors are different hues of the main color and are combined in a specific manner in order to keep the theme consistent:

  • primary_color is by default the 500 hue of the primary color palette
  • primary_dark is by default the 700 hue of the primary color palette
  • primary_light is by default the 100 hue of the primary color palette

Warning

The palettes Brown, Grey and BlueGrey doesn’t have any accent colors.

It’s recommended not to use more than three different hues of the primary color. However, the default hues can be customized:

# Set the primary color hue to '400'
theme_manager.primary_hue = '400'

# Set the primary dark hue to '900'
theme_manager.primary_dark_hue = '900'

# Set the primary light hue to '200'
theme_manager.primary_light_hue = '200'

The accent_palette is used to set the accent color in the app:

# Set the accent color to 'Red'
theme_manager.accent_palette = 'Red'

The accent_color should be used for primary action buttons and components like switches or sliders. The main accent color uses the A200 hue but if the background is too light or dark there are two fallback colors that can be used instead:

  • accent_dark is by default the A400 hue of the accent color
  • accent_light is by default the A100 hue of the accent color

These default accent color hues can also be customized:

# Set the accent color main hue to 'A400'
theme_manager.accent_hue = 'A400'

# Set the darker fallback accent color to 'A700'
theme_manager.accent_dark_hue = 'A700'

Text color

The color of the text within the app is determined primarily by the theme_style. Different text blocks should be separated by their importance relative to other text:

primary_text_color - This is the primary color for text blocks.

Note

  • Light: primary_text_color = 87% black
  • Dark: primary_text_color = 100% white

secondary_text_color - This is the secondary color that should be used for text that’s not as important as other text.

Note

  • Light: secondary_text_color = 54% black
  • Dark: secondary_text_color = 70% white

hint_text_color - This is the color used for hint text by MaterialTextInput().

Note

  • Light: hint_text_color = 26% black
  • Dark: hint_text_color = 30% white

disabled_color is the same color as hint_text_color and should be used for disabled widgets such as MaterialFlatButton().

divider_color - This is the color used by Divider().

Note

  • Light: hint_text_color = 12% black
  • Dark: hint_text_color = 12% white
theme_style¶

Set the overall color scheme.

Determines the main_background_color and dialog_background_color.

Available styles:
  • ‘Light’
  • ‘Dark’

The theme_style is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to Light.

main_background_color¶

(Read only) main_background_color holds the main background color.

This is a attribute that’s determined by the theme_style:

  • theme_style('Light') sets the main_background_color to Grey 200 (in rgb)
  • theme_style('Dark') sets the main_background_color (0.188, 0.188, 0.188)

The main_background_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to Grey 200 in rgb.

dialog_background_color¶

(Read only) dialog_background_color holds the background color used by MaterialDialog() and MaterialCard().

This is a attribute that’s determined by the theme_style:

  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Light') sets the dialog_background_color to Grey 50 (in rgb)
  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Dark') sets the dialog_background_color to Grey 800 (in rgb)

The main_background_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to Grey 200 in rgb.

primary_palette¶

The primary color palette.

Available palettes:
  • ‘Pink’
  • ‘Blue’
  • ‘Indigo’
  • ‘BlueGrey’
  • ‘Brown’
  • ‘LightBlue’
  • ‘Purple’
  • ‘Grey’
  • ‘Yellow’
  • ‘LightGreen’
  • ‘DeepOrange’
  • ‘Green’
  • ‘Red’
  • ‘Teal’
  • ‘Orange’
  • ‘Cyan’
  • ‘Amber’
  • ‘DeepPurple’
  • ‘Lime’

A Material Design theme is by default limited to three hues of the primary_palette:

  • 500 - the default hue that will be used for the :class:kivymd.`Toolbar` and should be used for other larger color blocks.
  • 700 - a darker hue.
  • 100 - a lighter hue.

Note

The primary_hue, primary_dark_hue and primary_light_hue can be customized by setting a different hue for the individual attributes.

ThemeManager.primary_color holds the primary color of the currently selected primary palette (in rgb).

ThemeManager.primary_dark holds the dark hue of the currently selected primary palette (in rgb).

ThemeManager.primary_light holds the light hue of the currently selected primary palette (in rgb).

The primary_palette is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to Grey.

primary_hue¶

The primary_hue holds the default hue for the primary color palette.

Available hues:
  • ‘50’
  • ‘100’
  • ‘200’
  • ‘300’
  • ‘400’
  • ‘500’
  • ‘600’
  • ‘700’
  • ‘800’
  • ‘900’
  • ‘A100’ (not in palettes ``Brown``, ``Grey`` and ``BlueGrey``)
  • ‘A200’ (not in palettes ``Brown``, ``Grey`` and ``BlueGrey``)
  • ‘A400’ (not in palettes ``Brown``, ``Grey`` and ``BlueGrey``)
  • ‘A700’ (not in palettes ``Brown``, ``Grey`` and ``BlueGrey``)

The primary_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to 500.

primary_dark_hue¶

The primary_dark_hue holds the darker hue for the primary color palette.

Available hues:
  • See documentation on primary_hue

The primary_dark_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to ‘700’.

primary_light_hue¶

The primary_light_hue holds the darker hue for the primary color palette.

Available hues:
  • See documentation on primary_hue

The primary_light_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to 100.

primary_color¶

(Read only) primary_color holds the primary 500 hue of the currently selected primary_palette in rgb.

The primary_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to ‘Grey 500’ in rgb format.

primary_dark¶

(Read only) primary_dark holds the darker 700 hue of the currently selected primary_palette in rgb.

The primary_dark is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to ‘Grey 700’ in rgb format.

primary_light¶

(Read only) primary_light holds the lighter 100 hue of the currently selected primary_palette in rgb.

The primary_light is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to ‘Grey 100’ in rgb format.

accent_palette¶

The accent color palette.

Available accent palettes:
  • ‘Pink’
  • ‘Blue’
  • ‘Indigo’
  • ‘LightBlue’
  • ‘Purple’
  • ‘Yellow’
  • ‘LightGreen’
  • ‘DeepOrange’
  • ‘Green’
  • ‘Red’
  • ‘Teal’
  • ‘Orange’
  • ‘Cyan’
  • ‘Amber’
  • ‘DeepPurple’
  • ‘Lime’

Use the accent color for your primary action button and components like switches or sliders.

Note

If your accent color is too light or dark for the background color, choose accent_light or accent_dark as a fallback for these cases.

ThemeManager.accent_color holds the currently selected A200 accent color (in rgb).

ThemeManager.accent_light holds the lighter A100 hue of the currently selected accent color (in rgb).

ThemeManager.accent_dark holds the darker A400 fallback hue of the currently selected accent color (in rgb).

Note

The accent_color, accent_light and accent_dark can be customized by setting a different hue for the individual attributes.

The accent_palette is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to Teal.

accent_hue¶

The accent_hue holds the default hue for the accent color palette.

Available hues:
  • See documentation on primary_hue

The accent_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to A200.

accent_light_hue¶

The accent_light_hue holds the lighter fallback hue for the accent color palette.

Available hues:
  • See documentation on primary_hue

The accent_light_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to A100.

accent_dark_hue¶

The accent_dark_hue holds the darker fallback hue for the accent color palette.

Available hues:
  • See documentation on primary_hue

The accent_dark_hue is a kivy.properties.OptionProperty and defaults to A400.

accent_color¶

(Read only) accent_color holds the A200 hue of the currently selected accent_palette in rgb.

The accent_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to Teal A200 in rgb format.

accent_light¶

(Read only) accent_light holds the lighter A100 hue of the currently selected accent_palette in rgb.

The accent_light is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to Teal A100 in rgb format.

accent_dark¶

(Read only) accent_dark holds the darker A400 hue of the currently selected accent_palette in rgb.

The accent_dark is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to Teal A400 in rgb format.

primary_text_color¶

(Read only) primary_text_color holds the primary text color.

This is determined by the theme_style:

  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Light') sets the primary_text_color to 87% black (in rgb)
  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Dark') sets the primary_text_color to 100% white (in rgb)

The primary_text_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 87% black in rgb.

secondary_text_color¶

(Read only) secondary_text_color holds the secondary text color.

This is determined by the theme_style:

  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Light') sets the secondary_text_color to 54% black (in rgb)
  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Dark') sets the secondary_text_color to 70% white (in rgb)

The secondary_text_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 54% black in rgb.

hint_text_color¶

(Read only) hint_text_color holds the hint text color. This is determined by the theme_style:

  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Light') sets the hint_text_color to 26% black (in rgb)
  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Dark') sets the hint_text_color to 30% white (in rgb)

The hint_text_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 26% black in rgb.

disabled_color¶

The disabled_color is the same as hint_text_color and is only there to make things more clear.

The disabled_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 26% black in rgb.

divider_color¶

(Read only) divider_color holds the divider color. This is determined by the theme_style:

  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Light') sets the divider_color to 12% black (in rgb)
  • ThemeManager.theme_style('Dark') sets the divider_color to 12% white (in rgb)

The divider_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 12% black in rgb.

error_color¶

error_color holds the color used for error text messages.

To change the error_color use:

theme_manager.error_color = ['Red', '900']

The divider_color is a kivy.properties.AliasProperty and defaults to 12% black in rgb.
